images.caption:
Figure 1:Visualizing Unlearning via Model Merging.
The vanilla model (top) initially assigns high probabilities to forget set (member) and low probabilities to holdout data (nonmember).
We then merge two individually unlearned models:
one exhibiting over-forgetting (middle left) and the other under-forgetting (middle right).
Model merging aims to achieve balanced forgetting (bottom), effectively reducing the model’s confidence in predicting sensitive member data while preserving its performance on nonmember data.
Figure 2:Performance Curves: Regurgitation and Knowledge Scores During Training.
Figure 3:Training Loss Curves of NPO and NPO+GDR+KLR.
